column4: So exactly how dangerous would it be to go to 2.6.24-21 in 8.04 ... or for that matter enable the "proposed" updates to run ?
is your current kernel ok?
did you update /etc/hostname and  /etc/hosts
what does ifconfig say its running at?
the tx line says 1000 but the speed is only 100 also network-manager says 100.  If i reboot and send the same set of files its massively faster
sudo /etc/init.d/networking restart
still says 100 in network-manager, 1000 in ifconfig and speed is still slow (80mb ish)
you could try specifying speed in /etc/network/interfaces file and set it up there
yeah let me just not use network-manager for the eth0 and see if that works, i had an issue with not getting gateway before
i dont use it. i think its worthless
let me make sure i am right here .. i need to edit interfaces only or interfaces and resolv.conf
interfaces should be ok, i would edit resolv.conf to add dns servers
they change all day though .. i plug in about 10 places
ah
will it dhcp them ?
well try it, just to test
yes, you will get dhcp (i believe) but the settings will override
once you have tested, if you remove that file and reboot you will get a fresh blank config
ok .. well i edited the interface file and now i am getting it scrolling to get dhcp for eth0 which is currently not pluged in
does it give up after a while of keep trying ?
ahh nm .. it gave up
then just comment out the config for eth0, or wait. it will time out
sorry to be a bother ... but unless i use network-manager i have no dns resolution.  the resolve.conf file is blank
should the resolv.conf file be blank.  shouldnt i be getting dns from dhcp like all the other clients on this network?
